ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Van Allen Probe A ECT HOPE Spin Resolved Level 2 Science Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata

Added DOI and PublicationInfo minted by LFB, updated InformationURL URLs as needed, updated the SPDF MetadataContact Person to Robert M. Candey, metadata updated to SPASE 2.4.1, reviewed by LFB 20220818

ResourceHeader.Description: This data set contains electron fluxes and proton fluxes measured by the Helium Oxygen Proton Electron (HOPE), which is one of three instruments on the Energetic Particle, Composition and Thermal Plasma Suite (ECT). As a mass spectrometer instrument, HOPE uses an electrostatic top-hat analyzer and time-gated coincidence detectors to measure electrons, protons, and helium and oxygen ions with energies from less than or equal to 20 eV or spacecraft potential (whichever is greater) to greater than or equal to 45 keV while rejecting penetrating backgrounds. Spectral measurements for both ions and electrons are acquired over 1 eV to 50 keV in 36 log-spaced steps at an energy resolution Î”EFWHM/E ~15%. The dominant ion species (H+, He+, and O+) of the magnetosphere are identified using foil-based time-of-flight mass (TOF) spectrometry with channel electron multiplier (CEM) detectors. Angular measurements are derived using five polar pixels in a plane perpendicular to the spacecraft spin axis, and up to 16 azimuthal bins are acquired for each polar pixel over time as the spacecraft spins. Electrons and protons are measured in alternate spin cadence of 5 per minute.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NASA Space Physics Data Facility (SPDF) CDAWeb.

Parameter.Name: Epoch
Parameter.Description: Default time
Parameter.Caveats: Epoch, UT

Parameter.Name: Satellite position (GEO)
Parameter.Description: [Time-series] Position of the satellite in geographic coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: Origin = Earths center of mass. X = Intersection of Greenwich meridian and geographic equator. Z = Geographic North Pole. Y = completes a right-handed Cartesian triad

Parameter.Name: Position_Quality
Parameter.Description: Position Quality flag
Parameter.Caveats: 0 denotes highest quality.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic field strength
Parameter.Description: Calculated magnetic field strength
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Equatorial magnetic field strength
Parameter.Description: Calculated magnetic field strength at magnetic equator
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: McIlwains L parameter
Parameter.Description: Calculated McIlwains L parameter (Earths radii)
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Roederers L* parameter
Parameter.Description: Calculated Roederers L* parameter (Earths radii)
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Adiabatic invariant (bounce)
Parameter.Description: Adiabatic invariant (bounce)
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Description: Calculated Magnetic Local Time (hours)
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Detector No.
Parameter.Description: Detector No.

Parameter.Name: Sector No.
Parameter.Description: Sector No.

Parameter.Name: Sector_Collapse for Counters data
Parameter.Description: Collapse method used for a given pixel.
Parameter.Caveats: For a given pixel, the number of spin angle sectors which are collapsed on board to fit the telemetry allocation. The collapse method sums all values together, then compresses according to the following algorithm: if (sum < 16384) {return sum} else {return ((sum-16384)/64) + 16384}

Parameter.Name: Acquisition_Period
Parameter.Description: Acquisition_Period
Parameter.Caveats: The length of a single ESA step acquisition

Parameter.Name: Plan
Parameter.Description: Science data acquisition Plan
Parameter.Caveats: Which science plan was used for the acquisition. The seclected science plan determines the ESA Sweep, TOF DAC, data product selection, and data collapse method used for an acquisition. As a general rule, plans 0-7 and 15 are reserved for HOPE nominal operations, and 8-14 are reserved for burst support operations.

Parameter.Name: Plan_Step
Parameter.Description: Plan_Step
Parameter.Caveats: Which step within a science plan was used. Each science plan consists of up to 16 steps, each of which can specify different HVPS and telemetry configuration settings.

Parameter.Name: ESA_Volt
Parameter.Description: ESA_Volt
Parameter.Caveats: Absolute values of the ESA voltage that was used for each energy step.

Parameter.Name: ESA_Volt_Ion
Parameter.Description: ESA_Volt_Ion
Parameter.Caveats: ESA voltage in ion mode (negative voltages)

Parameter.Name: Epoch_Ion
Parameter.Description: Default time
Parameter.Caveats: Epoch at times of ion mode measurements

Parameter.Name: Epoch_Ele
Parameter.Description: Default time
Parameter.Caveats: Epoch at times of electron mode measurements

Parameter.Name: ESA_Volt_Ion
Parameter.Description: ESA_Volt_Ion
Parameter.Caveats: ESA voltage in electron mode (positive voltages)

Parameter.Name: ESA_Polarity
Parameter.Description: Polarity of the ESA voltage.
Parameter.Caveats: Polarity of the ESA voltage. 0 = positive (electron mode), 1 = negative (ion mode)

Parameter.Name: ESA_Sweep
Parameter.Description: ESA_Sweep
Parameter.Caveats: Which of the 16 ESA Sweep ptables was used for the acquisition.

Parameter.Name: Cntr_Eclpse
Parameter.Description: Counter Energy Collapse
Parameter.Caveats: Whether or not energy collapsing was enabled for Counters (starts, stops, H+, He+, O+, e-, etc.) data. 0 = collapsed, 1 = not collapsed.

Parameter.Name: FPDU
Parameter.Description: [CreateCDF ONLY] FPDU: Differential directional proton flux ~15-50,000 eV (5 Detectors, 16 Sectors, 72 Energies)
Parameter.Caveats: Proton flux as a function of detector pixel (5), spin angle sector (16), and energy (72). Note that data have been expanded to the highest possible resolution (16 spin angles, 72 energies), even though in most cases the transmitted data are collapsed (36 energies, 4-8-16-8-4 spin angles) to fit the telemetry allocation.
